metadata.title: CVE-2024-36922 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: wifi:iwlwifi: read txq->read_ptr under lock If we read txq->read_ptr withoutlock, we can read the same value twice, then obtain the lock, and reclaimfrom there to two different places, but crucially reclaim the same entrytwice, resulting in the WARN_ONCE() a little later. Fix that by readingtxq->read_ptr under lock.
